snippet: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said a civil rights investigation had found “unreasonable and unnecessary use of force” by the department.
abstract: Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr says almost two-year civil rights probe into Cleveland Police Department has found pattern of 'unreasonable and unnecessary use of force' by officers; city has been in turmoil over fatal shooting of 12-year-old African-American boy Tamir Rice by rookie police officer.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington, Alan Blinder from Atlanta, and Adam Nagourney from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said a civil rights investigation had found “unreasonable and unnecessary use of force” by the department.

headline.main: Cleveland Police Cited for Abuse by Justice Department
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Police Cited for Abuse by Justice Dept.
